questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer is diagnosing an issue that occurred after a router at a branch site was assigned a new address. Based on the debugs, what must be done to resolve this issue?

A network engineer is setting up a clientless SSLVPN on a Cisco ASA. Remote users must be able to access an internal webserver via the URL example.com. Which two steps accomplish this task? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Configure a DNS server that can resolve the webserver URL.
choices.A: Configure a bookmark for the webserver.
choices.E: Configure routing so that the Cisco ASA can reach the webserver.
choices.D: Configure a browser plugin on the Cisco ASA.
choices.B: Configure routing so that the user's computer can reach the webserver.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
it is a web server, so you need a bookmark it and DNS to resolve the name to IP address, no plug-in required here

comments.content: You do not need to bookmark it to work. If users enter them in the browser bar.

correct A & C is the correct answer, i don't know why others selecting E & D, not related at all.
E: not related as they didn't mention to any specific plug-in require (web traffic).
D: not related at all. you need to Assign the bookmark to a VPN Profile. The routing setting not in VPN Profile.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
Note Bookmarks are an option feature in a typical SSLVPN.. DNS need to resolve URL and routing in place to route to the resolved IP address.

The answer is "A and C". 

To enable remote users to access an internal web server via the URL example.com using clientless SSL VPN on a Cisco ASA, the correct steps are:

Configure a bookmark for the web server:

This step involves creating a bookmark entry for the internal web server (example.com) on the Cisco ASA. The bookmark provides a convenient link for users to access the specified web resource.
Configure a DNS server that can resolve the web server URL:

For clientless SSL VPN to work, the ASA needs to be able to resolve the internal web server's URL (example.com) to its corresponding IP address. Ensure that the ASA has access to a DNS server that can resolve the DNS queries for the specified URL.
So, the correct steps are to configure a bookmark for the web server and configure a DNS server that can resolve the web server URL. This ensures that users can access the internal web server via the specified URL, and the DNS resolution is in place to translate the URL to the corresponding IP address.
The correct answer is A and C.
so if answer is CE admin why are you leaving AC?? here is any unreliable source of all sources

Selected Answer: CE
A is optional, so CE are correct

According to the cisco website, 

"""
(Optional) Create bookmarks for content.
Bookmarks allow the user to easily browse the internal resources without having to remember the URLs.
"""

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security-vpn/webvpn-ssl-vpn/119417-config-asa-00.html

Selected Answer: CE
I agree with Net4dd. A URL can be entered manually, meaning a bookmark is optional

Selected Answer: CE
DNS is required, so C is your first answer.
For the second answer, it's a tossup between A and E, since both are correct: 
- clientside: A (users will need that bookmark)
- serverside: E since you need to route traffic from the ASA to the webserver.

comments.content: Yes, but bookmarks are optional and routing is mandatory, so it should be CE

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Add bookmark and make sure ASA can resolve the site url

Selected Answer: CE
C is mandatory if we are using names, and E is required to guarantee basic L3 connectivity between ASA and the Server cause it will not necessarily be locally connected through L2. A is optional.

questions.question_text: A network engineer has set up a FlexVPN server to terminate multiple FlexVPN clients. The VPN tunnels are established without issue. However, when a Change of Authorization is issued by the RADIUS server, the FlexVPN server does not update the authorization of connected FlexVPN clients. Which action resolves this issue?

discussion.content: coa is needed on the server to update the client sessions....C

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_conn_ike2vpn/configuration/xe-16-10/sec-flex-vpn-xe-16-10-book/sec-ikev2-flex-coa.html

Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/sec_conn_ike2vpn/configuration/xe-16-10/sec-flex-vpn-xe-16-10-book/sec-ikev2-flex-coa.html

choices.A: Add the aaa server radius dynamic-author command on the FlexVPN clients.
choices.B: Fix the RADIUS key mismatch between the RADIUS server and FlexVPN server.
choices.C: Add the aaa server radius dynamic-author command on the FlexVPN server.
choices.D: Fix the RADIUS key mismatch between the RADIUS server and FlexVPN clients.

choices.A: Use a DAP registry check on the system to determine the relationship with the corporate domain.
choices.B: Use a DAP file check on the system to determine the relationship with the corporate domain.
choices.C: Install and authenticate user certificates on the corporate devices.
choices.D: Install and authenticate machine certificates on the corporate devices

discussion.content: To accomplish the goals of ensuring only corporate issued laptops and devices connect with the Cisco AnyConnect client, as well as providing remote remediation for stolen devices, it is recommended to use machine certificates for authentication. By installing and authenticating machine certificates on the devices, you can establish a secure connection between the client and the Cisco AnyConnect VPN gateway. This ensures that only devices with valid machine certificates issued by the corporate domain can connect to the VPN. Additionally, machine certificates provide a higher level of security and are applicable to multiple operating systems, including Windows, MacOS, and Linux. This allows for a consistent and unified approach across different platforms. By using machine certificates, if a corporate issued device is stolen or compromised, the certificate can be revoked or disabled remotely. This prevents unauthorized access to the VPN, enhancing security and mitigating potential risks.

Selected Answer: D
Certificate on the machine is the best option here.
if rght answer is D then why admin of this site letting wrong answers show???

Selected Answer: D
Machine certificates is the right solution. (D)
DAP registry check (A) is wrong, there is no registry in Mac or Linux

Selected Answer: D
Customers usually do double authentication using RADIUS or LDAP plus Machine Certificate, to make sure the certificate is signed and belongs to the domain.

Selected Answer: A
A is answr

Selected Answer: D
DAP will not revoke access to a stolen or lost PC. It only verifies that the system meets specific security requirements such as antivirus being installed. A machine certificate, however, can be revoked on the CA server that the VPN head end will validate against.

comments.content:
Answer is definitely not A.

This is because only Windows OS has a registry. Non-Windows operating systems do not have a registry.

Moreover, the link you provided mentions the following.
Scanning for registry endpoint attributes applies to Windows operating systems only.

The correct answer is D as machine certificates are the most secure and it also applies to all operating systems.

discussion.content:
